com.iha.emulator.control.scheduler

Interface Scheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DetailedScheduler, PerformanceScheduler

    public interface Scheduler
    Interface used for scheduling sending messages to server.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky
    See Also:
    com.iha.emulator.control.scheduler.implemented

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Scheduler.Type
      Enum with scheduler types

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearResponseTracker()
      Clears saved responses
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets scheduler's thread name
      ResponseTracker getResponseTracker()
      Gets assigned response tracker class.
      Scheduler.Type getType()
      Gets scheduler's type
      void interrupt()
      Interrupts scheduler's thread
      boolean isAlive()
      Checks, if scheduler's thread is alive
      boolean isContinueProcessing()
      Indicates, whether scheduler is currently processing messages.
      void join()
      Joins scheduler's thread with thread, that created it
      void processTracking(OutMessage message)
      If response tracking is enabled, saves response time to adapter's log message.
      void run()
      Method called after scheduler's thread is started.
      void setDaemon(boolean b)
      Sets scheduler's thread as daemon thread
      void setResponseTracker(ResponseTracker responseTracker)
      Sets response tracker for scheduler
      void start()
      Starts scheduler's thread
      void startProcessing()
      Sets process indicator to start and notifies thread if it is waiting
      void stopProcessing()
      Sets process indicator to stop.
      void terminateScheduler(boolean clearResponses)
      Clears all saved responses in assigned ResponseTracker and terminates scheduler's thread.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run()
        Method called after scheduler's thread is started. Providing logic to send and process messages between server and emulator.

      • clearResponseTracker

        void clearResponseTracker()
        Clears saved responses

      • processTracking

        void processTracking(OutMessage message)
        If response tracking is enabled, saves response time to adapter's log message. Also if response dumping is enabled, clears this response.
        Parameters:
        message - message to server containing adapter's log message

      • startProcessing

        void startProcessing()
        Sets process indicator to start and notifies thread if it is waiting

      • stopProcessing

        void stopProcessing()
        Sets process indicator to stop. Because of this indicator scheduler puts it's thread to waiting state.

      • terminateScheduler

        void terminateScheduler(boolean clearResponses)
        Clears all saved responses in assigned ResponseTracker and terminates scheduler's thread.
        Parameters:
        clearResponses - true if responses should be cleared, false otherwise

      • getResponseTracker

        ResponseTracker getResponseTracker()
        Gets assigned response tracker class.
        Returns:
        response tracker

      • setResponseTracker

        void setResponseTracker(ResponseTracker responseTracker)
        Sets response tracker for scheduler
        Parameters:
        responseTracker - response tracker

      • isContinueProcessing

        boolean isContinueProcessing()
        Indicates, whether scheduler is currently processing messages.
        Returns:
        true if processing, false otherwise

      • setDaemon

        void setDaemon(boolean b)
        Sets scheduler's thread as daemon thread
        Parameters:
        b - true if wish to set scheduler's thread as daemon, false otherwise

      • start

        void start()
        Starts scheduler's thread

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Checks, if scheduler's thread is alive
        Returns:
        true if is alive, false otherwise

      • interrupt

        void interrupt()
        Interrupts scheduler's thread

      • join

        void join()
   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Joins scheduler's thread with thread, that created it
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - interrupted while waiting on parent thread

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets scheduler's thread name
        Returns:
        scheduler's thread name

      • getType

        Scheduler.Type getType()
        Gets scheduler's type
        Returns:
        scheduler's type
